The '''Perl Shell''' (psh) is a [[command line interface|command line]] environment that can be used as the user's primary post-login [[Shell (computing)|shell]] on [[Unix-like]] operating systems.
The '''Perl Shell''' (psh) is a [[command line interface|command line]] environment that can be used as the user's primary post-login [[Shell (computing)|shell]] on [[Unix-like]] operating systems.
â
Being itself written in [[Perl]], psh can also be used under [[Microsoft Windows]] (with or without [[Cygwin]] or [[Interix]]) and other operating systems. Packages are available for [[Linux distribution]]s like [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]] and [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], though on most systems it can be installed from [[CPAN]] by simply issuing the following command:
+
